get.summary:
Returns a paginated list of `Asset` objects associated with your organization.

### Example Response

    {
        "count": 1,
        "next": null,
        "previous": null,
        "results": [
          {
            "id": "asdfv34d",
            "name": "Title",
            "type": "Video",
            "embed_link_url": "url://url",
            "aspect_ratio": "16:9",
            "sync_completion": true
          }
        ]
    }

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.summary:
Creates an `Asset` object.

The file will be downloaded from the remote source and re-hosted in Skilljar.

### Example Request

{
    "content_url": "url://foofoo/video.mp4",
    "asset": {
        "name": "string",
        "sync_completion": true
    }
}

Valid fields in the `asset` request object:
* `name` (OPTIONAL, default: built dynamically)
* `embed_link_url` (OPTIONAL, but must be present if content_url is not)
* `aspect_ratio` (OPTIONAL, can only be 16:9 or 4:3, default 16:9)
* `sync_completion` (OPTIONAL, default False)

-----

### Example Response

{
    "id": "asdfv34d",
    "name": "Title",
    "type": "Video",
    "embed_link_url": "url://url",
    "aspect_ratio": "16:9",
    "sync_completion": true
}

get.summary:
Retrieves details for an asset associated with your organization.
### Example Response

{
    "id": "asdfv34d",
    "name": "Title",
    "type": "Video",
    "embed_link_url": "url://url",
    "aspect_ratio": "16:9",
    "sync_completion": true
}

* download_url is a signed url that will be valid for 1 hour after generation.

get.summary: List ILT sessions. Returns a paginated list.

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

instructor_email.title: Instructor email
instructor_email.description: Instructor email, can be provided either as instructor@example.com or Instructor Name <instructor@example.com> for events without a provider.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: The session provider. Can be one of calendar, goto.meeting, goto.training, goto.webinar, goto.webcast, webex.meeting, webex.webinar, webex.training, zoom.meeting, zoom.webinar. Defaults to calendar.

seats_total.title: Seats total
seats_total.description: The maximum number of event registrants, empty if disabled. This cannot be set for sessions belonging to a multi-session event.

post_registration_instructions.title: Post registration instructions
post_registration_instructions.description: HTML shown to the user after registering

multi_session_event.title: Multi session event
multi_session_event.description: The MultiSessionEvent that this ViltSessionEvent belongs to. It is required to set either this or lesson.

lesson.title: Lesson
lesson.description: The Lesson that this ViltSessionEvent belongs to. It is required to set either this or multi_session_event.

location.title: Location
location.description: The location where the event will be held. This cannot be set for non-calendar sessions.

starts_at.title: Starts at
starts_at.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating when the start of the event is scheduled

ends_at.title: Ends at
ends_at.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating when the end of the event is scheduled

event_link.title: Event link
event_link.description: URL allowing users to join the event. This cannot be set for non-calendar sessions.

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: ISO 8601 formatted timezone of the event

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags. Cannot be set on sessions attached to a multi-session event.

get.summary: Get lesson progress details.

put.summary:
Update for lesson progress.  PUT and PATCH are identical - both do partial updates. Setting finished_at
indicates that the student has finished the content. This will also mark the lesson complete unless the lesson
requires validation, such as a review of proctoring. To un-complete the lesson, set completed_at to null.

finished_at.title: Finished at
finished_at.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating when the user finished the lesson content. Setting this field will also mark the lesson complete unless the lesson requires validation, such as a review of proctoring.

completed_at.title: Completed at
completed_at.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating when the user completed the lesson.  If null, the user has not completed the lesson.

validation_data.title: Validation data
validation_data.description: JSON formatted. Ignored if the lesson does not require validation.

patch.summary:
Partial update for lesson progress.  PUT and PATCH are identical - both do partial updates. Setting finished_at
indicates that the student has finished the content. This will also mark the lesson complete unless the lesson
requires validation, such as a review of proctoring. To un-complete the lesson, set completed_at to null.

finished_at.title: Finished at
finished_at.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating when the user finished the lesson content. Setting this field will also mark the lesson complete unless the lesson requires validation, such as a review of proctoring.

completed_at.title: Completed at
completed_at.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating when the user completed the lesson.  If null, the user has not completed the lesson.

validation_data.title: Validation data
validation_data.description: JSON formatted. Ignored if the lesson does not require validation.

get.summary: List PromoCodePools.  Returns a paginated list (1000 results per page) based upon the filters supplied.

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.
Filter results by the id of a Offer
Filter results by PromoCodePool name

post.summary:
Create a PromoCodePool

Example POST body (if POSTing JSON rather than form-encoded parameters):

    {
        "name": "promo-code-pool-name-1",
        "active": true,
        "discount_type": "PERCENT_OFF",
        "percent_off": 100,
        "single_use_per_user": false,
        "starts_at": "2018-03-16T16:45:55.946094Z",
        "expires_at": "2018-10-16T16:45:55.946094Z",
    }

    Or

    {
        "name": "promo-code-pool-name-1",
        "active": true,
        "discount_type": "PRICE_OVERRIDE",
        "price_cents": 5000,
        "single_use_per_user": false,
        "starts_at": "2018-03-16T16:45:55.946094Z",
        "expires_at": "2018-10-16T16:45:55.946094Z",
    }

starts_at.title: Starts at
starts_at.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating the start of the promo code pool

expires_at.title: Expires at
expires_at.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating the expiration of the promo code pool

get.summary: Get PromoCodePool details

expires_at.title: Expires at
expires_at.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating the expiration of the promo code pool

patch.summary: Update for promo-code-pools. PUT and PATCH are identical - both do partial updates

expires_at.title: Expires at
expires_at.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating the expiration of the promo code pool

delete.summary:
Deletes a PromoCodePool record. As a result, the associated PromoCode will also be deleted.
Any purchases that used the previously associated PromoCode will now be updated to have a null value for code_used.
This action cannot be undone.

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.
Filter results by the id of a Offer
Filter results by the code used - case sensitive
Filter results by active (true or false)

post.summary:
Create a PromoCode.
A PromoCodePool must exist before attempting to post to this endpoint.

Example POST body (if POSTing JSON rather than form-encoded parameters):

    {
        "code": "6hhzj2ea-v5j3ak3d",
        "max_uses": 30,
        "active": true,
        "promo_code_pool_id": "9uips0sdja",
    }

get.summary: Get PromoCode details

put.summary: Update for promo-codes. PUT and PATCH are identical - both do partial updates.

delete.summary: Deletes a PromoCode record. This action cannot be undone.

refunded_at.title: refunded_at

refund_cents.title: refund_cents

order_id.title: order_id
order_id.description: A unique order ID for the Purchase

price_cents.title: price_cents

offer_price_cents.title: offer_price_cents
offer_price_cents.description: Price (in cents) of the Offer purchased

promo_code_price_cents.title: promo_code_price_cents
promo_code_price_cents.description: Price (in cents) of the PromoCode used

tax_price_cents.title: tax_price_cents
tax_price_cents.description: Price (in cents) of local tax on the Purchase

payment_processor_order_id.title: payment_processor_order_id
payment_processor_order_id.description: ID for the payment processor used

payment_processor_response_data.title: payment_processor_response_data
payment_processor_response_data.description: Response from the payment processor used

currency_code.title: currency_code
currency_code.description: Type of currency used for the Purchase

put.summary: Update purchase details. PUT and PATCH are identical - both do partial updates.

patch.summary: Update purchase details. PUT and PATCH are identical - both do partial updates.

post.summary:
Fulfill specific purchase. Updates the purchase state, and if "SUCCESS", fulfills the purchase,
creating any necessary course or domain registrations.

error_msg.title: Error msg
error_msg.description: Optional: This error message will be presented to the user after they return to Skilljar, and will be set as the status_msg on the Purchase

payment_processor_order_id.title: Payment processor order id
payment_processor_order_id.description: Optional: The id of the transaction within the payment processor system, for reference only

payment_processor_response_data.title: Payment processor response data
payment_processor_response_data.description: Optional: Purchase metadata. For reference only. JSON format is recommended

get.summary: List all question banks. Returns a paginated list (defaults to 1000 results per page).

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the question bank.

quiz.title: Quiz
quiz.description: The quiz that this question belongs to. It is required to set either this or quiz_question_bank.

quiz_question_bank.title: Quiz question bank
quiz_question_bank.description: The question bank that this question belongs to. It is required to set either this or quiz.

html.title: Html
html.description: The HTML content of the question.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of question to create. Can be: MULTIPLE_CHOICE, MULTIPLE_ANSWER, FILL_IN_THE_BLANK, FREEFORM.

requires_manual_grading.title: Requires manual grading
requires_manual_grading.description: If checked for any question on the quiz, student responses for the corresponding quiz must be manually graded by a dashboard user.

case_sensitive.title: Case sensitive
case_sensitive.description: If true, student responses must match the case of the answer to be correct. This only impacts FILL_IN_THE_BLANK questions.

correct_answer_feedback_html.title: Correct answer feedback html
correct_answer_feedback_html.description: The feedback to display if the student answers the question correctly.

incorrect_answer_feedback_html.title: Incorrect answer feedback html
incorrect_answer_feedback_html.description: The feedback to display if the student answers the question incorrectly.

answers.title: Answers

get.summary: List all quizzes. Returns a paginated list (defaults to 1000 results per page).

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.
Filter Quizzes by quiz name - Case sensitive and exact match

post.summary:
Create a quiz. Example POST body (if POSTing JSON rather than form-encoded parameters): { "name": "Quiz 1", "html": "

This quiz covers the content from lessons 1, 2, and 3.

", "passing_percentage_correct": 75, "show_results_on_failure": true, "max_attempts": 3, "randomize_questions": true }

html.title: Html
html.description: The HTML content of the quiz.

passing_percentage_correct.title: Passing percentage correct
passing_percentage_correct.description: Percentage needed to mark quiz as passing.

show_results_on_failure.title: Show results on failure
show_results_on_failure.description: If set, students who fail the quiz will be able to see the answers they submitted as well as the correct / incorrect status and feedback for each question. Correct answers will not be displayed.  (Students who pass the quiz are shown correct / incorrect status, feedback, and correct answers by default.)

max_attempts.title: Max attempts
max_attempts.description: By default (0), there is no limit to how many times a student may take the quiz.

require_correct_response.title: Require correct response
require_correct_response.description: If set, the student must answer each question correctly in order to proceed to the next question. When set, there is no limit to the number of attempts to answer the question correctly.

randomize_questions.title: Randomize questions
randomize_questions.description: If set, the student will receive questions in a random order.

limit_question_count.title: Limit question count
limit_question_count.description: By default (0), the student will have to answer every question below. Otherwise, they will receive this many questions selected at random.

randomize_answers.title: Randomize answers
randomize_answers.description: If set, the student will receive question answers in a random order (this applies to every question on the quiz).

time_limit_seconds.title: Time limit seconds
time_limit_seconds.description: Set a time limit on the quiz. If left blank, students will have unlimited time to complete the quiz.

show_question_feedback.title: Show question feedback
show_question_feedback.description: If set, students will be able to receive feedback for correct / incorrect answers on their quiz for automatically graded questions (multiple choice, multiple answer, and fill in the blank questions.) If unchecked, all feedback entered previously will be deleted.

get.summary: List Training-Credit Codes.  Returns a paginated list (1000 results per page) based upon the filters supplied.

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.
Filter results by tracking_identifier
Filter results by training credit code name

training_credit_code.title: Training credit code
training_credit_code.description: String used by Learners to apply Training Credit balance on the course platform and purchase Training content.

credits_total.title: Credits total
credits_total.description: Total number of credits stored on this code.

expiration_date.title: Expiration date
expiration_date.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating the expiration of the training credit code

expire_content.title: Expire content
expire_content.description: If true, when this code is used, learners will lose access to content when the code expires.

tracking_identifier.title: Tracking identifier
tracking_identifier.description: Custom string for teams to identify codes in Financial/reporting tools. Is not used by Skilljar.

available_to_all_students.title: Available to all students
available_to_all_students.description: Set to "true" if all learners should be able to use this credit code.

student_groups.description: Required if the above option is "false". Use this format to include student_group ids: ["2d4EXAMPLE0ea32j", "2d4EXAMPLE20esh5y"]

available_for_all_offers.description: Set to "true" if this credit code should be available for all existing and future offers that have credit value.

offers.description: Required if the above option is "false". Use this format to include offer_ids: ["2d4EXAMPLE0ea32j", "2d4EXAMPLE20esh5y"]

expiration_date.title: Expiration date
expiration_date.description: ISO 8601 formatted datetime string indicating the expiration of the training credit code

expire_content.title: Expire content
expire_content.description: If true, when this code is used, learners will lose access to content when the code expires.

tracking_identifier.title: Tracking identifier
tracking_identifier.description: Custom string for teams to identify codes in Financial/reporting tools. Is not used by Skilljar.

available_to_all_students.title: Available to all students
available_to_all_students.description: Set to "true" if all learners should be able to use this credit code.

student_groups.title: Student groups
student_groups.description: Required if the above option is "false". Use this format to add or remove student_group ids - Add resolves first, then Remove: { "add": ["2d4EXAMPLE0ea32j", "2d4EXAMPLE20esh5y"], "remove": ["9k4EXAMPLE20h5ysK"] }

available_for_all_offers.title: Available for all offers

offers.title: Offers
offers.description: Required if the above option is "false". Use this format to add or remove offer_ids - Add resolves first, then Remove: { "add": ["2d4EXAMPLE0ea32j", "2d4EXAMPLE20esh5y"], "remove": ["9k4EXAMPLE20h5ysK"] }

get.summary:
List users who have registered on at least one domain.  Returns a paginated list (1000 results per page) of
users.

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.
Filter users by email address
Filter users by first name - case sensitive
Filter users by last name - case sensitive

get.summary: Get user's course registration overview.

put.summary: Update for user details. Only name and email address may be changed. PUT and PATCH are identical - both do partial updates.

patch.summary:
Partial update for user details. Only name and email address may be changed.
PUT and PATCH are identical - both do partial updates.

post.summary:
Obfuscate all data that could be used to identify the user, either directly, or indirectly.

This will permanently update the user, deleting sensitive information and preventing
future usage of the platform. This action is not reversible.

get.summary: List ViltSessionEvents.  Returns a paginated list based upon the filters supplied.

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.
Filter ViltSessionEvents by exact match of a Course ID
Filter ViltSessionEvents by exact match of a Lesson ID
Filter where a ViltSessionEvent is greater than or equal to the starts at value. Datetime format
Filter where a ViltSessionEvent is less than or equal to the ends at value. Datetime format

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

get.summary: Get ViltSessionRegistration details

put.summary: Update for vilt-session-registrations. Only attendance may be changed. PUT and PATCH are identical - both do partial updates.

patch.summary: Update for vilt-session-registrations. Only attendance may be changed. PUT and PATCH are identical - both do partial updates.

delete.summary: Deletes a ViltSessionRegistration record, marks student as unattended for the ViltSessionEvent. This action cannot be undone.

get.summary:
Returns a paginated list of `WebPackage` objects associated with your organization.

### Example Response

    {
        "count": 1,
        "next": null,
        "previous": null,
        "results": [
            {
                "id": "13k7y5yndi8er",
                "type": "SCORM",
                "redirect_on_completion": true,
                "state": "READY",
                "sync_completion": false,
                "title": "Now That's What I Call Learning! Volume 23"
            }
    }

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.summary:
Creates a `WebPackage` object from a remotely hosted zip file.

The file will be downloaded from the remote source and re-hosted in Skilljar.

### Example Request

    {
        "content_url": "https://www.skilljar.com/example_scorm.zip",
        "web_package": {
            "title": "Now That's What I Call Learning! Volume 23",
            "redirect_on_completion": true,
            "sync_on_completion": false
        }
    }

Valid fields in the `web_package` request object:

* `title` (REQUIRED):  This title will be overridden once the web package is processed.
* `redirect_on_completion` (OPTIONAL, default: `true`)
* `sync_on_completion`: (OPTIONAL, default: `false`)

-----

### Example Response

    {
        "id": "13k7y5yndi8er",
        "type": "SCORM",
        "redirect_on_completion": true,
        "state": "PROCESSING",
        "sync_completion": false,
        "title": "Now That's What I Call Learning! Volume 23"
    }

Creation responses are still processing and don't include the `type` or `download_url` fields.

get.summary:
Retrieves details for a web package associated with your organization.

### Example Response

    {
        "id": "13k7y5yndi8er",
        "type": "SCORM",
        "download_url": "https://[...]",
        "redirect_on_completion": true,
        "state": "READY",
        "sync_completion": false,
        "title": "Now That's What I Call Learning! Volume 23"
    }

* download_url is a signed url that will be valid for 1 hour after generation.

web_package_id.title: Web package id
web_package_id.description: WebPackage that will replace the other in its lessons

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

post.summary:
Create a webhook. The Skilljar system will send HTTP POST requests to the given URL when events occur within
the platform. If the "event_type" field is null, all events will be sent to the given URL. If the field is set,
only events matching the type provided will be sent to the given URL. If multiple webhooks qualify for an
event and have the same URL, the event will be sent to the URL only once.

event_type.title: Event type
event_type.description: 'COURSE_COMPLETION', 'COURSE_ENROLLMENT', 'DOMAIN_ENROLLMENT', 'LESSON_COMPLETION', 'PATH_COMPLETION', 'PATH_ENROLLMENT', 'PURCHASE_FULFILLMENT', 'QUIZ_COMPLETION', 'VILT_EVENT_REGISTRATION', 'DASHBOARD_TASK_CREATED', or null. If null, all events, regardless of type, will be sent to the webhook URL.

basic_auth_username.title: Basic auth username
basic_auth_username.description:
When set, this webhook will include the HTTP Basic Authentication 
        header when making a request to the target_url. This will be the username.

basic_auth_password.title: Basic auth password
basic_auth_password.description:
When set, this webhook will include the HTTP Basic Authentication 
        header when making a request to the target_url. This will be the password.

additional_headers.title: Additional headers
additional_headers.description: Dictionary of string values to include as additional HTTP headers in the webhook request. Key pairs included in this JSON dictionary will be added as individual HTTP headers to all webhook POST requests. Use double quotes for keys and values

get.summary:
Get webhook details.

Example Response:

    {
        "id": "abcd1234",
        "target_url": "http://example.com/skilljar-hook-processor",
        "event_type": null,
        "active": true,
        "deactivate_reason": null
    }

event_type.description: 'COURSE_COMPLETION', 'COURSE_ENROLLMENT', 'DOMAIN_ENROLLMENT', 'LESSON_COMPLETION', 'PATH_COMPLETION', 'PATH_ENROLLMENT', 'PURCHASE_FULFILLMENT', 'QUIZ_COMPLETION', 'VILT_EVENT_REGISTRATION', 'DASHBOARD_TASK_CREATED', or null. If null, all events, regardless of type, will be sent to the webhook URL.
